    task_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255),

)

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE schedules (
    schedule_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255),
    task_description TEXT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE tasks (
    task_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255),
    task_description TEXT,
    task_type VARCHAR(50),
    task_frequency INTERVAL
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE schedules SET task_name = 'Meeting' WHERE schedule_id = '1b9d6bcd-bbfd-4b2d-9b5d-ab8dfbbd4ba0';

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE lights_schedule (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    task_name VARCHAR(255),
    task_description TEXT,
    start_time TIMESTAMP,
    end_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE,
    email VARCHAR(255),
    password TEXT,
    role VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    action VARCHAR(255),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE lights_schedule SET task_description = 'Updated Description' WHERE id = 1;
